headline.print_headline: With New Line of Snack Foods, Ali Makes Youth Obesity an Opponent
headline.main: With Food Line, Ali Makes Obesity an Opponent

docs.lead_paragraph: The newest eat-healthy contender, Muhammad Ali, will offer reduced-calorie foods and beverages for young adults.
docs.snippet: The newest eat-healthy contender, Muhammad Ali, will offer reduced-calorie foods and beverages for young adults.

headline.print_headline: Age of Transfused Blood May Play Part in Recovery
headline.main: Age of Transfused Blood May Play Part in Recovery

docs.lead_paragraph: The risk of premature death for heart surgery patients increased significantly with each day the transfused blood had been stored, a recent study found.
docs.snippet: The risk of premature death for heart surgery patients increased significantly with each day the transfused blood had been stored, a recent study found.

headline.print_headline: On Special At Your Local Supermarket: Moral Choices
headline.main: On Special at Your Local Supermarket: Moral Choices

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new books describe not just what Americans like to eat but also what we ought to eat.
docs.snippet: Two new books describe not just what Americans like to eat but also what we ought to eat.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 50th anniversary of the Interstate System offers a chance to reconsider the designs of our highways.
docs.snippet: The 50th anniversary of the Interstate System offers a chance to reconsider the designs of our highways.

docs.abstract: Judith Warner questions the wisdom of bullying mothers into breast-feeding their babies - and vilifying those who don't.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last Tuesday's Science Times article on the U.S. government's public awareness campaign to promote breast-feeding left me feeling queasy. Not because I question the superior benefits for babies and mothers of breast- over bottle-feeding. Nor because, to anticipate the criticism normally lobbed at those who challenge the tenor of today's pro-breast dogma, I am in some way in the pocket of the formula industry or indifferent to children's health needs, or ignorant of the decades of research - detailed throughout the Times story - suggesting that breast-feeding may help ward off ailments ranging from ear infections to cancer.
docs.snippet: Judith Warner questions the wisdom of bullying mothers into breast-feeding their babies - and vilifying those who don't.

headline.print_headline: MANHATTAN: CHANGES PROPOSED IN CITY FOOD RULES
headline.main: Manhattan: Changes Proposed in City Food Rules

docs.lead_paragraph: Councilman Joel Rivera, left, the chairman of the City Council Health Committee, said yesterday that he would introduce a zoning change to limit the number of fast-food restaurants in low-income areas and increase the number of farmers' markets as a way to combat obesity. Mr. Rivera, of the Bronx, spoke during a committee hearing.
